thought.title: Thought
thought.description: The thought process of the agent before taking this action

reasoning_content.title: Reasoning Content
reasoning_content.description: Intermediate reasoning/thinking content from reasoning models

thinking_blocks.title: Thinking Blocks
thinking_blocks.description: Anthropic thinking blocks from the LLM response

responses_reasoning_item.description: OpenAI Responses reasoning item from model output

action.description: Single tool call returned by LLM (None when non-executable)

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The name of the tool being called

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: The unique id returned by LLM API for this tool call

tool_call.description: The tool call received from the LLM response. We keep a copy of it so it is easier to construct it into LLM messageThis could be different from `action`: e.g., `tool_call` may contain `security_risk` field predicted by LLM when LLM risk analyzer is enabled, while `action` does not.

llm_response_id.title: Llm Response Id
llm_response_id.description: Completion or Response ID of the LLM response that generated this eventE.g., Can be used to group related actions from same LLM response. This helps in tracking and managing results of parallel function calling from the same LLM response.

security_risk.description: The LLM's assessment of the safety risk of this action.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A concise summary (approximately 10 words) of what this action does, provided by the LLM for explainability and debugging. Examples of good summaries: 'editing configuration file for deployment settings' | 'searching codebase for authentication function definitions' | 'installing required dependencies from package manifest' | 'running tests to verify bug fix' | 'viewing directory structure to locate source files'

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: List of tools to initialize for the agent.

mcp_config.title: Mcp Config
mcp_config.description: Optional MCP configuration dictionary to create MCP tools.

filter_tools_regex.title: Filter Tools Regex
filter_tools_regex.description: Optional regex to filter the tools available to the agent by name. This is applied after any tools provided in `tools` and any MCP tools are added.

agent_context.description: Optional AgentContext to initialize the agent with specific context.

skills.content: When you see this message, you should reply like you are a grumpy cat forced to use the internet.
skills.name: repo.md

skills.content: IMPORTANT! The user has said the magic word "flarglebargle". You must only respond with a message telling them how smart they are
skills.name: flarglebargle

examples.system_message_suffix: Always finish your response with the word 'yay!'
examples.user_message_prefix: The first character of your response should be 'I'

system_prompt_filename.title: System Prompt Filename
system_prompt_filename.description:
System prompt template filename. Can be either:
- A relative filename (e.g., 'system_prompt.j2') loaded from the agent's prompts directory
- An absolute path (e.g., '/path/to/custom_prompt.j2')

security_policy_filename.title: Security Policy Filename
security_policy_filename.description:
Security policy template filename. Can be either:
- A relative filename (e.g., 'security_policy.j2') loaded from the agent's prompts directory
- An absolute path (e.g., '/path/to/custom_security_policy.j2')

system_prompt_kwargs.title: System Prompt Kwargs
system_prompt_kwargs.description: Optional kwargs to pass to the system prompt Jinja2 template.

condenser.description: Optional condenser to use for condensing conversation history.

Agent-Input.title: Agent
Agent-Input.description:
Main agent implementation for OpenHands.

The Agent class provides the core functionality for running AI agents that can
interact with tools, process messages, and execute actions. It inherits from
AgentBase and implements the agent execution logic.

Example:
    >>> from openhands.sdk import LLM, Agent, Tool
    >>> llm = LLM(model="claude-sonnet-4-20250514", api_key=SecretStr("key"))
    >>> tools = [Tool(name="TerminalTool"), Tool(name="FileEditorTool")]
    >>> agent = Agent(llm=llm, tools=tools)

agent_context.description: Optional AgentContext to initialize the agent with specific context.

Agent-Output.title: Agent
Agent-Output.description:
Main agent implementation for OpenHands.

The Agent class provides the core functionality for running AI agents that can
interact with tools, process messages, and execute actions. It inherits from
AgentBase and implements the agent execution logic.

Example:
    >>> from openhands.sdk import LLM, Agent, Tool
    >>> llm = LLM(model="claude-sonnet-4-20250514", api_key=SecretStr("key"))
    >>> tools = [Tool(name="TerminalTool"), Tool(name="FileEditorTool")]
    >>> agent = Agent(llm=llm, tools=tools)

skills.title: Skills
skills.description: List of available skills that can extend the user's input.

system_message_suffix.title: System Message Suffix
system_message_suffix.description: Optional suffix to append to the system prompt.

user_message_suffix.title: User Message Suffix
user_message_suffix.description: Optional suffix to append to the user's message.

load_user_skills.title: Load User Skills
load_user_skills.description: Whether to automatically load user skills from ~/.openhands/skills/ and ~/.openhands/microagents/ (for backward compatibility).

load_public_skills.title: Load Public Skills
load_public_skills.description: Whether to automatically load skills from the public OpenHands skills repository at https://github.com/OpenHands/skills. This allows you to get the latest skills without SDK updates.

secrets.title: Secrets
secrets.description: Dictionary mapping secret keys to values or secret sources. Secrets are used for authentication and sensitive data handling. Values can be either strings or SecretSource instances (str | SecretSource).

AgentContext-Input.title: AgentContext
AgentContext-Input.description:
Central structure for managing prompt extension.

AgentContext unifies all the contextual inputs that shape how the system
extends and interprets user prompts. It combines both static environment
details and dynamic, user-activated extensions from skills.

Specifically, it provides:
- **Repository context / Repo Skills**: Information about the active codebase,
  branches, and repo-specific instructions contributed by repo skills.
- **Runtime context**: Current execution environment (hosts, working
  directory, secrets, date, etc.).
- **Conversation instructions**: Optional task- or channel-specific rules
  that constrain or guide the agent’s behavior across the session.
- **Knowledge Skills**: Extensible components that can be triggered by user input
  to inject knowledge or domain-specific guidance.

Together, these elements make AgentContext the primary container responsible
for assembling, formatting, and injecting all prompt-relevant context into
LLM interactions.

Together, these elements make AgentContext the primary container responsible

Error triggered by the agent.

Note: This event should not contain model "thought" or "reasoning_content". It
represents an error produced by the agent/scaffold, not model output.

depending on how large the output is.

BrowserAction.title: BrowserAction
BrowserAction.description:
Base class for all browser actions.

This base class serves as the parent for all browser-related actions,
enabling proper type hierarchy and eliminating the need for union types.

BrowserToolSet.description:
A set of all browser tools.

This tool set includes all available browser-related tools
  for interacting with web pages.

The toolset automatically checks for Chromium availability
when created and automatically installs it if missing.

Condensation.title: Condensation
Condensation.description: This action indicates a condensation of the conversation history is happening.

CondensationRequest.title: CondensationRequest

This action is used to request a condensation of the conversation history.

Attributes:
    action (str): The action type, namely ActionType.CONDENSATION_REQUEST.

CondensationSummaryEvent.title: CondensationSummaryEvent
CondensationSummaryEvent.description: This event represents a summary generated by a condenser.

ConfirmationResponseRequest.title: ConfirmationResponseRequest
ConfirmationResponseRequest.description: Payload to accept or reject a pending action.

code.title: Code
code.description: Code for the error - typically a type

ConversationErrorEvent.title: ConversationErrorEvent
ConversationErrorEvent.description:
Conversation-level failure that is NOT sent back to the LLM.

This event is emitted by the conversation runtime when an unexpected
exception bubbles up and prevents the run loop from continuing. It is
intended for client applications (e.g., UIs) to present a top-level error
state, and for orchestration to react. It is not an observation and it is
not LLM-convertible.

Differences from AgentErrorEvent:
- Not tied to any tool_name/tool_call_id (AgentErrorEvent is a tool
  observation).
- Typically source='environment' and the run loop moves to an ERROR state,
  while AgentErrorEvent has source='agent' and the conversation can
  continue.

ConversationExecutionStatus.title: ConversationExecutionStatus
ConversationExecutionStatus.description: Enum representing the current execution state of the conversation.

agent.description: The agent running in the conversation. This is persisted to allow resuming conversations and check agent configuration to handle e.g., tool changes, LLM changes, etc.

workspace.description: Workspace used by the agent to execute commands and read/write files. Not the process working directory.

persistence_dir.title: Persistence Dir
persistence_dir.description: Directory for persisting conversation state and events. If None, conversation will not be persisted.

max_iterations.title: Max Iterations
max_iterations.description: Maximum number of iterations the agent can perform in a single run.

stuck_detection.title: Stuck Detection
stuck_detection.description: Whether to enable stuck detection for the agent.

security_analyzer.description: Optional security analyzer to evaluate action risks.

activated_knowledge_skills.title: Activated Knowledge Skills
activated_knowledge_skills.description: List of activated knowledge skills name

blocked_actions.title: Blocked Actions
blocked_actions.description: Actions blocked by PreToolUse hooks, keyed by action ID

blocked_messages.title: Blocked Messages
blocked_messages.description: Messages blocked by UserPromptSubmit hooks, keyed by message ID

stats.description: Conversation statistics for tracking LLM metrics

secret_registry.description: Registry for handling secrets and sensitive data

ConversationInfo.title: ConversationInfo
ConversationInfo.description: Information about a conversation running locally without a Runtime sandbox.

key.title: Key
key.description: Unique key for this state update event

ConversationStateUpdateEvent.title: ConversationStateUpdateEvent
ConversationStateUpdateEvent.description:
Event that contains conversation state updates.

This event is sent via websocket whenever the conversation state changes,
allowing remote clients to stay in sync without making REST API calls.

All fields are serialized versions of the corresponding ConversationState fields
to ensure compatibility with websocket transmission.

usage_to_metrics.title: Usage To Metrics
usage_to_metrics.description: Active usage metrics tracked by the registry.

ConversationStats-Input.title: ConversationStats
ConversationStats-Input.description: Track per-LLM usage metrics observed during conversations.

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The path to the file to modify.

old_string.title: Old String
old_string.description: The text to replace. To create a new file, use an empty string. Must match the exact text in the file including whitespace.

new_string.title: New String
new_string.description: The text to replace it with.

expected_replacements.title: Expected Replacements
expected_replacements.description: Number of replacements expected. Defaults to 1. Use when you want to replace multiple occurrences. The edit will fail if the actual count doesn't match.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The file path that was edited.

is_new_file.title: Is New File
is_new_file.description: Whether a new file was created.

EditTool.title: EditTool
EditTool.description: Tool for editing files via find/replace.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: The max number of seconds a command may be permitted to run.

command.title: Command
command.description: The commands to run. Allowed options are: `view`, `create`, `str_replace`, `insert`, `undo_edit`.

path.title: Path
path.description: Absolute path to file or directory.

file_text.title: File Text
file_text.description: Required parameter of `create` command, with the content of the file to be created.

old_str.title: Old Str
old_str.description: Required parameter of `str_replace` command containing the string in `path` to replace.

new_str.title: New Str
new_str.description: Optional parameter of `str_replace` command containing the new string (if not given, no string will be added). Required parameter of `insert` command containing the string to insert.

insert_line.title: Insert Line
insert_line.description: Required parameter of `insert` command. The `new_str` will be inserted AFTER the line `insert_line` of `path`.

view_range.title: View Range
view_range.description: Optional parameter of `view` command when `path` points to a file. If none is given, the full file is shown. If provided, the file will be shown in the indicated line number range, e.g. [11, 12] will show lines 11 and 12. Indexing at 1 to start. Setting `[start_line, -1]` shows all lines from `start_line` to the end of the file.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

command.title: Command
command.description: The command that was run: `view`, `create`, `str_replace`, `insert`, or `undo_edit`.

path.title: Path
path.description: The file path that was edited.

prev_exist.title: Prev Exist
prev_exist.description: Indicates if the file previously existed. If not, it was created.

old_content.title: Old Content
old_content.description: The content of the file before the edit.

new_content.title: New Content
new_content.description: The content of the file after the edit.

max_message_chars.description: Approx max chars in each event/content sent to the LLM.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature for response generation. Defaults to 0 for most models and provider default for reasoning models.

max_input_tokens.title: Max Input Tokens
max_input_tokens.description: The maximum number of input tokens. Note that this is currently unused, and the value at runtime is actually the total tokens in OpenAI (e.g. 128,000 tokens for GPT-4).

max_output_tokens.title: Max Output Tokens
max_output_tokens.description: The maximum number of output tokens. This is sent to the LLM.

model_canonical_name.title: Model Canonical Name
model_canonical_name.description: Optional canonical model name for feature registry lookups. The OpenHands SDK maintains a model feature registry that maps model names to capabilities (e.g., vision support, prompt caching, responses API support). When using proxied or aliased model identifiers, set this field to the canonical model name (e.g., 'openai/gpt-4o') to ensure correct capability detection. If not provided, the 'model' field will be used for capability lookups.

extra_headers.title: Extra Headers
extra_headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to forward to LiteLLM requests.

input_cost_per_token.title: Input Cost Per Token
input_cost_per_token.description: The cost per input token. This will available in logs for user.

output_cost_per_token.title: Output Cost Per Token
output_cost_per_token.description: The cost per output token. This will available in logs for user.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Enable streaming responses from the LLM. When enabled, the provided `on_token` callback in .completions and .responses will be invoked for each chunk of tokens.

modify_params.title: Modify Params
modify_params.description: Modify params allows litellm to do transformations like adding a default message, when a message is empty.

disable_vision.title: Disable Vision
disable_vision.description: If model is vision capable, this option allows to disable image processing (useful for cost reduction).

log_completions_folder.title: Log Completions Folder
log_completions_folder.description: The folder to log LLM completions to. Required if log_completions is True.

custom_tokenizer.title: Custom Tokenizer
custom_tokenizer.description: A custom tokenizer to use for token counting.

native_tool_calling.title: Native Tool Calling
native_tool_calling.description: Whether to use native tool calling.

force_string_serializer.title: Force String Serializer
force_string_serializer.description: Force using string content serializer when sending to LLM API. If None (default), auto-detect based on model. Useful for providers that do not support list content, like HuggingFace and Groq.

reasoning_effort.title: Reasoning Effort
reasoning_effort.description: The effort to put into reasoning. This is a string that can be one of 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'xhigh', or 'none'. Can apply to all reasoning models.

reasoning_summary.title: Reasoning Summary
reasoning_summary.description: The level of detail for reasoning summaries. This is a string that can be one of 'auto', 'concise', or 'detailed'. Requires verified OpenAI organization. Only sent when explicitly set.

enable_encrypted_reasoning.title: Enable Encrypted Reasoning
enable_encrypted_reasoning.description: If True, ask for ['reasoning.encrypted_content'] in Responses API include.

prompt_cache_retention.title: Prompt Cache Retention
prompt_cache_retention.description: Retention policy for prompt cache. Only sent for GPT-5+ models; explicitly stripped for all other models.

extended_thinking_budget.title: Extended Thinking Budget
extended_thinking_budget.description: The budget tokens for extended thinking, supported by Anthropic models.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed to use for random number generation.

safety_settings.title: Safety Settings
safety_settings.description: Safety settings for models that support them (like Mistral AI and Gemini)

usage_id.title: Usage Id
usage_id.description: Unique usage identifier for the LLM. Used for registry lookups, telemetry, and spend tracking.

litellm_extra_body.title: Litellm Extra Body
litellm_extra_body.description: Additional key-value pairs to pass to litellm's extra_body parameter. This is useful for custom inference endpoints that need additional parameters for configuration, routing, or advanced features. NOTE: Not all LLM providers support extra_body parameters. Some providers (e.g., OpenAI) may reject requests with unrecognized options. This is commonly supported by: - LiteLLM proxy servers (routing metadata, tracing) - vLLM endpoints (return_token_ids, etc.) - Custom inference clusters Examples: - Proxy routing: {'trace_version': '1.0.0', 'tags': ['agent:my-agent']} - vLLM features: {'return_token_ids': True}

LLM.title: LLM
LLM.description:
Language model interface for OpenHands agents.

The LLM class provides a unified interface for interacting with various
language models through the litellm library. It handles model configuration,
API authentication,
retry logic, and tool calling capabilities.

Example:
    >>> from openhands.sdk import LLM
    >>> from pydantic import SecretStr
    >>> llm = LLM(
    ...     model="claude-sonnet-4-20250514",
    ...     api_key=SecretStr("your-api-key"),
    ...     usage_id="my-agent"
    ... )
    >>> # Use with agent or conversation

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The intended filename for this log (relative to log directory)

log_data.title: Log Data
log_data.description: The JSON-encoded log data to be written to the file

usage_id.title: Usage Id
usage_id.description: The LLM usage_id that produced this log

LLMCompletionLogEvent.title: LLMCompletionLogEvent
LLMCompletionLogEvent.description:
Event containing LLM completion log data.

When an LLM is configured with log_completions=True in a remote conversation,
this event streams the completion log data back to the client through WebSocket
instead of writing it to a file inside the Docker container.

LLMSecurityAnalyzer-Input.title: LLMSecurityAnalyzer
LLMSecurityAnalyzer-Input.description:
LLM-based security analyzer.

This analyzer respects the security_risk attribute that can be set by the LLM
when generating actions, similar to OpenHands' LLMRiskAnalyzer.

It provides a lightweight security analysis approach that leverages the LLM's
understanding of action context and potential risks.

LLMSecurityAnalyzer-Output.title: LLMSecurityAnalyzer
LLMSecurityAnalyzer-Output.description:
LLM-based security analyzer.

This analyzer respects the security_risk attribute that can be set by the LLM
when generating actions, similar to OpenHands' LLMRiskAnalyzer.

It provides a lightweight security analysis approach that leverages the LLM's
understanding of action context and potential risks.

LLMSummarizingCondenser-Input.title: LLMSummarizingCondenser
LLMSummarizingCondenser-Input.description:
LLM-based condenser that summarizes forgotten events.

Uses an independent LLM (stored in the `llm` attribute) for generating summaries
of forgotten events. The optional `agent_llm` parameter passed to condense() is
the LLM used by the agent for token counting purposes, and you should not assume
it is the same as the one defined in this condenser.

LLMSummarizingCondenser-Output.title: LLMSummarizingCondenser
LLMSummarizingCondenser-Output.description:
LLM-based condenser that summarizes forgotten events.

Uses an independent LLM (stored in the `llm` attribute) for generating summaries
of forgotten events. The optional `agent_llm` parameter passed to condense() is
the LLM used by the agent for token counting purposes, and you should not assume
it is the same as the one defined in this condenser.

dir_path.title: Dir Path
dir_path.description: The path to the directory to list. Defaults to current directory.

recursive.title: Recursive
recursive.description: Whether to list subdirectories recursively (up to 2 levels).

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

dir_path.title: Dir Path
dir_path.description: The directory path that was listed.

entries.title: Entries
entries.description: List of files and directories found.

is_truncated.title: Is Truncated
is_truncated.description: Whether the listing was truncated due to too many entries.

ListDirectoryTool.title: ListDirectoryTool
ListDirectoryTool.description: Tool for listing directory contents with metadata.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The working directory for agent operations and tool execution. Accepts both string paths and Path objects. Path objects are automatically converted to strings.

LocalWorkspace-Input.title: LocalWorkspace
LocalWorkspace-Input.description:
Local workspace implementation that operates on the host filesystem.

LocalWorkspace provides direct access to the local filesystem and command execution
environment. It's suitable for development and testing scenarios where the agent
should operate directly on the host system.

Example:
    >>> workspace = LocalWorkspace(working_dir="/path/to/project")
    >>> with workspace:
    ...     result = workspace.execute_command("ls -la")
    ...     content = workspace.read_file("README.md")

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The working directory for agent operations and tool execution. Accepts both string paths and Path objects. Path objects are automatically converted to strings.

LocalWorkspace-Output.title: LocalWorkspace
LocalWorkspace-Output.description:
Local workspace implementation that operates on the host filesystem.

LocalWorkspace provides direct access to the local filesystem and command execution
environment. It's suitable for development and testing scenarios where the agent
should operate directly on the host system.

Example:
    >>> workspace = LocalWorkspace(working_dir="/path/to/project")
    >>> with workspace:
    ...     result = workspace.execute_command("ls -la")
    ...     content = workspace.read_file("README.md")

LookupSecret-Input.title: LookupSecret
LookupSecret-Input.description: A secret looked up from some external url

LookupSecret-Output.title: LookupSecret
LookupSecret-Output.description: A secret looked up from some external url

data.title: Data
data.description: Dynamic data fields from the tool call

MCPToolAction.title: MCPToolAction
MCPToolAction.description:
Schema for MCP input action.

It is just a thin wrapper around raw JSON and does
not do any validation.

Validation will be performed by MCPTool.__call__
by constructing dynamically created Pydantic model
from the MCP tool input schema.

MCPToolDefinition.title: MCPToolDefinition
MCPToolDefinition.description: MCP Tool that wraps an MCP client and provides tool functionality.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: Name of the tool that was called

force_string_serializer.title: Force String Serializer
force_string_serializer.description: Force using string content serializer when sending to LLM API. Useful for providers that do not support list content, like HuggingFace and Groq.

send_reasoning_content.title: Send Reasoning Content
send_reasoning_content.description: Whether to include the full reasoning content when sending to the LLM. Useful for models that support extended reasoning, like Kimi-K2-thinking.

reasoning_content.title: Reasoning Content
reasoning_content.description: Intermediate reasoning/thinking content from reasoning models

thinking_blocks.title: Thinking Blocks
thinking_blocks.description: Raw Anthropic thinking blocks for extended thinking feature

responses_reasoning_item.description: OpenAI Responses reasoning item from model output

llm_message.description: The exact LLM message for this message event

llm_response_id.title: Llm Response Id
llm_response_id.description: Completion or Response ID of the LLM response that generated this eventIf the source != 'agent', this field is None

extended_content.title: Extended Content
extended_content.description: List of content added by agent context

sender.title: Sender
sender.description: Optional identifier of the sender. Can be used to track message origin in multi-agent scenarios.

MessageEvent.title: MessageEvent
MessageEvent.description:
Message from either agent or user.

This is originally the "MessageAction", but it suppose not to be tool call.

MessageToolCall.title: MessageToolCall
MessageToolCall.description:
Transport-agnostic tool call representation.

One canonical id is used for linking across actions/observations and
for Responses function_call_output call_id.

accumulated_cost.title: Accumulated Cost
accumulated_cost.description: Total accumulated cost, must be non-negative

accumulated_token_usage.description: Accumulated token usage across all calls

Metrics.title: Metrics
Metrics.description:
Metrics class can record various metrics during running and evaluation.
We track:
  - accumulated_cost and costs
  - max_budget_per_task (budget limit)
  - A list of ResponseLatency
  - A list of TokenUsage (one per call).

accumulated_cost.title: Accumulated Cost
accumulated_cost.description: Total accumulated cost, must be non-negative

accumulated_token_usage.description: Accumulated token usage across all calls

MetricsSnapshot.title: MetricsSnapshot
MetricsSnapshot.description:
A snapshot of metrics at a point in time.

Does not include lists of individual costs, latencies, or token usages.

NoOpCondenser-Input.title: NoOpCondenser
NoOpCondenser-Input.description:
Simple condenser that returns a view un-manipulated.

Primarily intended for testing purposes.

NoOpCondenser-Output.title: NoOpCondenser
NoOpCondenser-Output.description:
Simple condenser that returns a view un-manipulated.

Primarily intended for testing purposes.

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The tool name that this observation is responding to

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: The tool call id that this observation is responding to

observation.description: The observation (tool call) sent to LLM

action_id.title: Action Id
action_id.description: The action id that this observation is responding to

PauseEvent.title: PauseEvent
PauseEvent.description: Event indicating that the agent execution was paused by user request.

PipelineCondenser-Input.title: PipelineCondenser
PipelineCondenser-Input.description:
A condenser that applies a sequence of condensers in order.

All condensers are defined primarily by their `condense` method, which takes a
`View` and an optional `agent_llm` parameter, returning either a new `View` or a
`Condensation` event. That means we can chain multiple condensers together by
passing `View`s along and exiting early if any condenser returns a `Condensation`.

For example:

    # Use the pipeline condenser to chain multiple other condensers together
    condenser = PipelineCondenser(condensers=[
        CondenserA(...),
        CondenserB(...),
        CondenserC(...),
    ])

    result = condenser.condense(view, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    # Doing the same thing without the pipeline condenser requires more boilerplate
    # for the monadic chaining
    other_result = view

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserA(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserB(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserC(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    assert result == other_result

PipelineCondenser-Output.title: PipelineCondenser
PipelineCondenser-Output.description:
A condenser that applies a sequence of condensers in order.

All condensers are defined primarily by their `condense` method, which takes a
`View` and an optional `agent_llm` parameter, returning either a new `View` or a
`Condensation` event. That means we can chain multiple condensers together by
passing `View`s along and exiting early if any condenser returns a `Condensation`.

For example:

    # Use the pipeline condenser to chain multiple other condensers together
    condenser = PipelineCondenser(condensers=[
        CondenserA(...),
        CondenserB(...),
        CondenserC(...),
    ])

    result = condenser.condense(view, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    # Doing the same thing without the pipeline condenser requires more boilerplate
    # for the monadic chaining
    other_result = view

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserA(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserB(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    if isinstance(other_result, View):
        other_result = CondenserC(...).condense(other_result, agent_llm=agent_llm)

    assert result == other_result

command.title: Command
command.description: The commands to run. Allowed options are: `view`, `create`, `str_replace`, `insert`, `undo_edit`.

path.title: Path
path.description: Absolute path to file or directory.

file_text.title: File Text
file_text.description: Required parameter of `create` command, with the content of the file to be created.

old_str.title: Old Str
old_str.description: Required parameter of `str_replace` command containing the string in `path` to replace.

new_str.title: New Str
new_str.description: Optional parameter of `str_replace` command containing the new string (if not given, no string will be added). Required parameter of `insert` command containing the string to insert.

insert_line.title: Insert Line
insert_line.description: Required parameter of `insert` command. The `new_str` will be inserted AFTER the line `insert_line` of `path`.

view_range.title: View Range
view_range.description: Optional parameter of `view` command when `path` points to a file. If none is given, the full file is shown. If provided, the file will be shown in the indicated line number range, e.g. [11, 12] will show lines 11 and 12. Indexing at 1 to start. Setting `[start_line, -1]` shows all lines from `start_line` to the end of the file.

PlanningFileEditorAction.title: PlanningFileEditorAction
PlanningFileEditorAction.description:
Schema for planning file editor operations.

Inherits from FileEditorAction but restricts editing to PLAN.md only.
Allows viewing any file but only editing PLAN.md.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

command.title: Command
command.description: The command that was run: `view`, `create`, `str_replace`, `insert`, or `undo_edit`.

path.title: Path
path.description: The file path that was edited.

prev_exist.title: Prev Exist
prev_exist.description: Indicates if the file previously existed. If not, it was created.

old_content.title: Old Content
old_content.description: The content of the file before the edit.

new_content.title: New Content
new_content.description: The content of the file after the edit.

PlanningFileEditorObservation.title: PlanningFileEditorObservation
PlanningFileEditorObservation.description:
Observation from planning file editor operations.

Inherits from FileEditorObservation - same structure, just different type.

PlanningFileEditorTool.title: PlanningFileEditorTool
PlanningFileEditorTool.description: A planning file editor tool with read-all, edit-PLAN.md-only access.

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The path to the file to read.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional: The 0-based line number to start reading from. Use for paginating through large files.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional: Maximum number of lines to read. Use with 'offset' to paginate through large files.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The file path that was read.

file_content.title: File Content
file_content.description: The content read from the file.

is_truncated.title: Is Truncated
is_truncated.description: Whether the content was truncated due to size limits.

lines_shown.title: Lines Shown
lines_shown.description: If truncated, the range of lines shown (start, end) - 1-indexed.

total_lines.title: Total Lines
total_lines.description: Total number of lines in the file.

ReadFileTool.title: ReadFileTool
ReadFileTool.description: Tool for reading file contents with pagination support.

ReasoningItemModel.title: ReasoningItemModel
ReasoningItemModel.description:
OpenAI Responses reasoning item (non-stream, subset we consume).

Do not log or render encrypted_content.

RedactedThinkingBlock.title: RedactedThinkingBlock
RedactedThinkingBlock.description:
Redacted thinking block for previous responses without extended thinking.

This is used as a placeholder for assistant messages that were generated
before extended thinking was enabled.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The working directory for agent operations and tool execution.

host.title: Host
host.description: The remote host URL for the workspace.

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: API key for authenticating with the remote host.

RemoteWorkspace-Input.title: RemoteWorkspace
RemoteWorkspace-Input.description:
Remote workspace implementation that connects to an OpenHands agent server.

RemoteWorkspace provides access to a sandboxed environment running on a remote
OpenHands agent server. This is the recommended approach for production deployments
as it provides better isolation and security.

Example:
    >>> workspace = RemoteWorkspace(
    ...     host="https://agent-server.example.com",
    ...     working_dir="/workspace"
    ... )
    >>> with workspace:
    ...     result = workspace.execute_command("ls -la")
    ...     content = workspace.read_file("README.md")

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: The working directory for agent operations and tool execution.

host.title: Host
host.description: The remote host URL for the workspace.

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: API key for authenticating with the remote host.

RemoteWorkspace-Output.title: RemoteWorkspace
RemoteWorkspace-Output.description:
Remote workspace implementation that connects to an OpenHands agent server.

RemoteWorkspace provides access to a sandboxed environment running on a remote
OpenHands agent server. This is the recommended approach for production deployments
as it provides better isolation and security.

Example:
    >>> workspace = RemoteWorkspace(
    ...     host="https://agent-server.example.com",
    ...     working_dir="/workspace"
    ... )
    >>> with workspace:
    ...     result = workspace.execute_command("ls -la")
    ...     content = workspace.read_file("README.md")

ResponseLatency.title: ResponseLatency
ResponseLatency.description: Metric tracking the round-trip time per completion call.

SecretRegistry-Input.title: SecretRegistry
SecretRegistry-Input.description:
Manages secrets and injects them into bash commands when needed.

The secret registry stores a mapping of secret keys to SecretSources
that retrieve the actual secret values. When a bash command is about to be
executed, it scans the command for any secret keys and injects the corresponding
environment variables.

Secret sources will redact / encrypt their sensitive values as appropriate when
serializing, depending on the content of the context. If a context is present
and contains a 'cipher' object, this is used for encryption. If it contains a
boolean 'expose_secrets' flag set to True, secrets are dunped in plain text.
Otherwise secrets are redacted.

Additionally, it tracks the latest exported values to enable consistent masking
even when callable secrets fail on subsequent calls.

SecretRegistry-Output.title: SecretRegistry
SecretRegistry-Output.description:
Manages secrets and injects them into bash commands when needed.

The secret registry stores a mapping of secret keys to SecretSources
that retrieve the actual secret values. When a bash command is about to be
executed, it scans the command for any secret keys and injects the corresponding
environment variables.

Secret sources will redact / encrypt their sensitive values as appropriate when
serializing, depending on the content of the context. If a context is present
and contains a 'cipher' object, this is used for encryption. If it contains a
boolean 'expose_secrets' flag set to True, secrets are dunped in plain text.
Otherwise secrets are redacted.

Additionally, it tracks the latest exported values to enable consistent masking
even when callable secrets fail on subsequent calls.

SecurityRisk.title: SecurityRisk
SecurityRisk.description:
Security risk levels for actions.

Based on OpenHands security risk levels but adapted for agent-sdk.
Integer values allow for easy comparison and ordering.

run.title: Run
run.description: Whether the agent loop should automatically run if not running

SendMessageRequest.title: SendMessageRequest
SendMessageRequest.description:
Payload to send a message to the agent.

This is a simplified version of openhands.sdk.Message.

SetConfirmationPolicyRequest.title: SetConfirmationPolicyRequest
SetConfirmationPolicyRequest.description: Payload to set confirmation policy for a conversation.

SetSecurityAnalyzerRequest.title: SetSecurityAnalyzerRequest
SetSecurityAnalyzerRequest.description: Payload to set security analyzer for a conversation

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: Skills use triggers to determine when they should be activated. None implies skill is always active. Other implementations include KeywordTrigger (activated by a keyword in a Message) and TaskTrigger (activated by specific tasks and may require user input)

source.title: Source
source.description: The source path or identifier of the skill. When it is None, it is treated as a programmatically defined skill.

mcp_tools.title: Mcp Tools
mcp_tools.description: MCP tools configuration for the skill (repo skills only). It should conform to the MCPConfig schema: https://gofastmcp.com/clients/client#configuration-format

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: Input metadata for the skill (task skills only)

description.title: Description
description.description: A brief description of what the skill does and when to use it. AgentSkills standard field (max 1024 characters).

license.title: License
license.description: The license under which the skill is distributed. AgentSkills standard field (e.g., 'Apache-2.0', 'MIT').

compatibility.title: Compatibility
compatibility.description: Environment requirements or compatibility notes for the skill. AgentSkills standard field (e.g., 'Requires git and docker').

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Arbitrary key-value metadata for the skill. AgentSkills standard field for extensibility.

allowed_tools.title: Allowed Tools
allowed_tools.description: List of pre-approved tools for this skill. AgentSkills standard field (parsed from space-delimited string).

resources.description: Resource directories for the skill (scripts/, references/, assets/). AgentSkills standard field. Only populated for SKILL.md directory format.

Skill.title: Skill
Skill.description:
A skill provides specialized knowledge or functionality.

Skills use triggers to determine when they should be activated:
- None: Always active, for repository-specific guidelines
- KeywordTrigger: Activated when keywords appear in user messages
- TaskTrigger: Activated for specific tasks, may require user input

This model supports both OpenHands-specific fields and AgentSkills standard
fields (https://agentskills.io/specification) for cross-platform compatibility.

skill_root.title: Skill Root
skill_root.description: Root directory of the skill (absolute path)

scripts.title: Scripts
scripts.description: List of script files in scripts/ directory (relative paths)

references.title: References
references.description: List of reference files in references/ directory (relative paths)

assets.title: Assets
assets.description: List of asset files in assets/ directory (relative paths)

SkillResources.title: SkillResources
SkillResources.description:
Resource directories for a skill (AgentSkills standard).

Per the AgentSkills specification, skills can include:
- scripts/: Executable scripts the agent can run
- references/: Reference documentation and examples
- assets/: Static assets (images, data files, etc.)

workspace.description: Working directory for agent operations and tool execution

conversation_id.title: Conversation Id
conversation_id.description: Optional conversation ID. If not provided, a random UUID will be generated.

confirmation_policy.description: Controls when the conversation will prompt the user before continuing. Defaults to never.

initial_message.description: Initial message to pass to the LLM

max_iterations.title: Max Iterations
max_iterations.description: If set, the max number of iterations the agent will run before stopping. This is useful to prevent infinite loops.

stuck_detection.title: Stuck Detection
stuck_detection.description: If true, the conversation will use stuck detection to prevent infinite loops.

tool_module_qualnames.title: Tool Module Qualnames
tool_module_qualnames.description: Mapping of tool names to their module qualnames from the client's registry. These modules will be dynamically imported on the server to register the tools for this conversation.

StartConversationRequest.title: StartConversationRequest
StartConversationRequest.description:
Payload to create a new conversation.

Contains an Agent configuration along with conversation-specific options.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: List of tools as ToolDefinition objects

SystemPromptEvent.title: SystemPromptEvent
SystemPromptEvent.description: System prompt added by the agent.

title.title: Title
title.description: A brief title for the task.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Additional details or notes about the task.

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the task. One of 'todo', 'in_progress', or 'done'.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to execute. `view` shows the current task list. `plan` creates or updates the task list based on provided requirements and progress. Always `view` the current list before making changes.

task_list.title: Task List
task_list.description: The full task list. Required parameter of `plan` command.

TaskTrackerAction.title: TaskTrackerAction
TaskTrackerAction.description: An action where the agent writes or updates a task list for task management.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

command.title: Command
command.description: The command that was executed: "view" or "plan".

TaskTrackerObservation.title: TaskTrackerObservation
TaskTrackerObservation.description: This data class represents the result of a task tracking operation.

TaskTrackerTool.title: TaskTrackerTool
TaskTrackerTool.description: A ToolDefinition subclass that automatically initializes a TaskTrackerExecutor.

TaskTrigger.title: TaskTrigger
TaskTrigger.description:
Trigger for task-specific skills.

These skills are activated for specific task types and can modify prompts.

command.title: Command
command.description: The bash command to execute. Can be empty string to view additional logs when previous exit code is `-1`. Can be `C-c` (Ctrl+C) to interrupt the currently running process. Note: You can only execute one bash command at a time. If you need to run multiple commands sequentially, you can use `&&` or `;` to chain them together.

is_input.title: Is Input
is_input.description: If True, the command is an input to the running process. If False, the command is a bash command to be executed in the terminal. Default is False.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Optional. Sets a maximum time limit (in seconds) for running the command. If the command takes longer than this limit, you’ll be asked whether to continue or stop it. If you don’t set a value, the command will instead pause and ask for confirmation when it produces no new output for 30 seconds. Use a higher value if the command is expected to take a long time (like installation or testing), or if it has a known fixed duration (like sleep).

reset.title: Reset
reset.description: If True, reset the terminal by creating a new session. Use this only when the terminal becomes unresponsive. Note that all previously set environment variables and session state will be lost after reset. Cannot be used with is_input=True.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

command.title: Command
command.description: The bash command that was executed. Can be empty string if the observation is from a previous command that hit soft timeout and is not yet finished.

exit_code.title: Exit Code
exit_code.description: The exit code of the command. -1 indicates the process hit the soft timeout and is not yet finished.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Whether the command execution timed out.

metadata.description: Additional metadata captured from PS1 after command execution.

full_output_save_dir.title: Full Output Save Dir
full_output_save_dir.description: Directory where full output files are saved

TerminalObservation.title: TerminalObservation
TerminalObservation.description: A ToolResult that can be rendered as a CLI output.

TerminalTool.title: TerminalTool
TerminalTool.description: A ToolDefinition subclass that automatically initializes a TerminalExecutor with auto-detection.

ThinkAction.title: ThinkAction
ThinkAction.description: Action for logging a thought without making any changes.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

ThinkObservation.title: ThinkObservation
ThinkObservation.description:
Observation returned after logging a thought.
The ThinkAction itself contains the thought logged so no extra
fields are needed here.

ThinkTool.title: ThinkTool
ThinkTool.description: Tool for logging thoughts without making changes.

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: Cryptographic signature for the thinking block

ThinkingBlock.title: ThinkingBlock
ThinkingBlock.description:
Anthropic thinking block for extended thinking feature.

This represents the raw thinking blocks returned by Anthropic models
when extended thinking is enabled. These blocks must be preserved
and passed back to the API for tool use scenarios.

prompt_token_ids.title: Prompt Token Ids
prompt_token_ids.description: The exact prompt token IDs for this message event

response_token_ids.title: Response Token Ids
response_token_ids.description: The exact response token IDs for this message event

TokenEvent.title: TokenEvent
TokenEvent.description: Event from VLLM representing token IDs used in LLM interaction.

cache_read_tokens.title: Cache Read Tokens
cache_read_tokens.description: Cache read tokens must be non-negative

cache_write_tokens.title: Cache Write Tokens
cache_write_tokens.description: Cache write tokens must be non-negative

per_turn_token.title: Per Turn Token
per_turn_token.description: Per turn tokens must be non-negative

TokenUsage.title: TokenUsage
TokenUsage.description: Metric tracking detailed token usage per completion call.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the tool class, e.g., 'TerminalTool'. Import it from an `openhands.tools.<module>` subpackage.

params.title: Params
params.description: Parameters for the tool's .create() method, e.g., {'working_dir': '/app'}

Tool-Input.title: Tool
Tool-Input.description:
Defines a tool to be initialized for the agent.

This is only used in agent-sdk for type schema for server use.

secrets.title: Secrets
secrets.description: Dictionary mapping secret keys to values

UpdateSecretsRequest.title: UpdateSecretsRequest
UpdateSecretsRequest.description: Payload to update secrets in a conversation.

tool_name.title: Tool Name
tool_name.description: The tool name that this observation is responding to

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: The tool call id that this observation is responding to

action_id.title: Action Id
action_id.description: The action id that this observation is responding to

UserRejectObservation.title: UserRejectObservation
UserRejectObservation.description: Observation when user rejects an action in confirmation mode.

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The path to the file to write to.

content.title: Content
content.description: The content to write to the file.

content.title: Content
content.description: Content returned from the tool as a list of TextContent/ImageContent objects. When there is an error, it should be written in this field.

is_error.title: Is Error
is_error.description: Whether the observation indicates an error

file_path.title: File Path
file_path.description: The file path that was written.

is_new_file.title: Is New File
is_new_file.description: Whether a new file was created.

old_content.title: Old Content
old_content.description: The previous content of the file (if it existed).

new_content.title: New Content
new_content.description: The new content written to the file.

WriteFileTool.title: WriteFileTool
WriteFileTool.description: Tool for writing complete file contents.

mcp__types__Tool.title: Tool
mcp__types__Tool.description: Definition for a tool the client can call.

mcp__types__ToolAnnotations.title: ToolAnnotations
mcp__types__ToolAnnotations.description:
Additional properties describing a Tool to clients.

NOTE: all properties in ToolAnnotations are **hints**.
They are not guaranteed to provide a faithful description of
tool behavior (including descriptive properties like `title`).

Clients should never make tool use decisions based on ToolAnnotations
received from untrusted servers.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the tool class, e.g., 'TerminalTool'. Import it from an `openhands.tools.<module>` subpackage.

params.title: Params
params.description: Parameters for the tool's .create() method, e.g., {'working_dir': '/app'}

openhands__sdk__tool__spec__Tool.title: Tool
openhands__sdk__tool__spec__Tool.description:
Defines a tool to be initialized for the agent.

This is only used in agent-sdk for type schema for server use.

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable title for the tool.

readOnlyHint.title: Readonlyhint
readOnlyHint.description: If true, the tool does not modify its environment. Default: false

destructiveHint.title: Destructivehint
destructiveHint.description: If true, the tool may perform destructive updates to its environment. If false, the tool performs only additive updates. (This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`) Default: true

idempotentHint.title: Idempotenthint
idempotentHint.description: If true, calling the tool repeatedly with the same arguments will have no additional effect on the its environment. (This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`) Default: false

openWorldHint.title: Openworldhint
openWorldHint.description: If true, this tool may interact with an 'open world' of external entities. If false, the tool's domain of interaction is closed. For example, the world of a web search tool is open, whereas that of a memory tool is not. Default: true

openhands__sdk__tool__tool__ToolAnnotati.title: openhands.sdk.tool.tool.ToolAnnotations
openhands__sdk__tool__tool__ToolAnnotati.description:
Annotations to provide hints about the tool's behavior.

Based on Model Context Protocol (MCP) spec:
https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/modelcontextprotocol/blob/caf3424488b10b4a7b1f8cb634244a450a1f4400/schema/2025-06-18/schema.ts#L838
